update.title: v0.2.2: Events over sockets

content.raw: right: the token could be verified only if emit is to be called
content.html: right: the token could be verified only if emit is to be called

content.raw: the question was more for the for loop above. Something to keep in mind if we start to work on improving performance later
content.html: the question was more for the for loop above. Something to keep in mind if we start to work on improving performance later

content.raw: tokens can expire after a specified time (and verify will catch that), so its better to verify often.
content.html: tokens can expire after a specified time (and verify will catch that), so its better to verify often.

content.raw: Yes, but that's only a convention. The Javascript language does not give any special meaning to identifiers starting with underscore characters.
content.html: Yes, but that's only a convention. The Javascript language does not give any special meaning to identifiers starting with underscore characters.

content.raw: do we need to verify all tokens when notifying only one / small subset of users?
content.html: do we need to verify all tokens when notifying only one / small subset of users?

content.raw: `_` prefix is a convention for private functions?
content.html: _ prefix is a convention for private functions?
